史.definition: history; annals; title of an official historian in ancient China

史丹頓島.definition: Staten Island, borough of New York City

史卓.definition: Straw (name); Jack Straw (1946-), UK Labour Party politician, foreign secretary 2001-2006

史思明.definition: Shi Siming (703-761), military colleague of An Lushan 安祿山|安禄山[An1 Lu4 shan1], participated in the 755-763 An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]

史提夫·賈伯斯.pinyin: shǐ tí fū · jiǎ bó sī
史提夫·賈伯斯.definition: Steve Jobs (1955-2011), US co-founder and CEO of Apple, Inc.

史普尼克.definition: Sputnik, Soviet artificial Earth satellite; also written 斯普特尼克

史景遷.definition: Jonathan D Spence (1936-), distinguished British US historian of China, author of The Search for Modern China 追尋現代中國|追寻现代中国[Zhui1 xun2 Xian4 dai4 Zhong1 guo2]

史氏蝗鶯.definition: (bird species of China) Styan's grasshopper warbler (Helopsaltes pleskei)

史沫特萊.definition: Agnes Smedley (1892-1950), US journalist and activist, reported on China, esp. the communist side

史泰博.definition: Staples Inc., US office supply store

史特勞斯.definition: (Tw) Strauss (name); Johann Strauss (1825-1899), Austrian composer; Richard Strauss (1864-1949), German composer

史瓦辛格.definition: Arnold Schwarzenegger (1947-), Austrian-born American bodybuilder, actor and politician

史稱.definition: to be known to history as

史籀篇.definition: Shizhoupian, early school primer in great seal script 大篆[da4 zhuan4], attributed to King Xuan of Zhou 周宣王[Zhou1 Xuan1 wang2] but probably dating from c. 500 BC

史臣.definition: official in charge of public records

史蒂夫·喬布斯.pinyin: shǐ dì fū · qiáo bù sī
史蒂夫·喬布斯.definition: Steve Jobs (1955-2011), US co-founder and CEO of Apple, Inc.

史蒂芬·哈珀.definition: see 斯蒂芬·哈珀[Si1 di4 fen1 · Ha1 po4]

史觀.definition: historical point of view; historically speaking

史記.definition: Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]

史迪威.definition: Joseph Stilwell (1883-1946), commander of US forces in China, Burma and India in World War II
